title: ACR/EULAR Gout Classification Criteria
description: Provides formal diagnostic criteria for gout using a 3-step approach: entry criterion, sufficient criterion, and classification criteria requiring ≥7 points for positive diagnosis

parameters.name: entry_criterion
parameters.description: ≥1 episode of swelling, pain, or tenderness in a peripheral joint/bursa

parameters.name: msu_crystals_present
parameters.description: Presence of Monosodium Urate (MSU) crystals in a symptomatic joint, bursa, or tophus

parameters.name: joint_pattern
parameters.description: Pattern of joint/bursa involvement during episodes

parameters.name: episode_characteristics
parameters.description: Number of characteristics during episode(s): erythema overlying joint, can't bear touch/pressure, great difficulty walking/using joint

parameters.name: typical_episodes
parameters.description: Number of episodes with typical time-course (≥2 symptoms: time to max pain <24h, resolution ≤14 days, complete resolution between episodes)

parameters.name: tophus_evidence
parameters.description: Evidence of tophus: draining or chalk-like subcutaneous nodule in typical locations

parameters.name: serum_urate
parameters.description: Serum urate level (measured by uricase method, ideally when not taking urate-lowering treatment and >4 weeks from episode)

parameters.name: synovial_fluid_analysis
parameters.description: Synovial fluid analysis of a symptomatic joint or bursa (assessed by trained observer)

parameters.name: imaging_urate_deposition
parameters.description: Imaging evidence of urate deposition in symptomatic joint/bursa (ultrasound double-contour sign OR DECT)

parameters.name: imaging_joint_damage
parameters.description: Imaging evidence of gout-related joint damage (X-ray of hands/feet with ≥1 erosion)

result.name: gout_classification_result
result.description: Gout classification result based on ACR/EULAR 2015 criteria

ranges.description: Does not meet gout classification criteria
ranges.interpretation: Score <7 points. Does not meet ACR/EULAR 2015 classification criteria for gout. Consider alternative diagnoses such as pseudogout, septic arthritis, or other crystal arthropathies.
Score ≥7 points. Meets ACR/EULAR 2015 classification criteria for gout. Diagnosis consistent with gout.

formula: Three-step approach: 1) Entry criterion (≥1 episode peripheral joint swelling/pain/tenderness); 2) Sufficient criterion (MSU crystals present = definite gout); 3) Classification criteria scoring (7+ points required): Joint pattern (0-2 pts), Episode characteristics (0-3 pts), Typical episodes (0-2 pts), Tophus (0 or 4 pts), Serum urate (-4 to +4 pts), Synovial fluid analysis (-2 or 0 pts), Imaging urate deposition (0 or 4 pts), Imaging joint damage (0 or 4 pts)
notes: Entry criterion must be met before proceeding to step 2
If MSU crystals are present in symptomatic joint/bursa/tophus, diagnosis is definite gout (sufficient criterion)
If MSU crystals not identified or not tested, proceed to classification criteria scoring
Score ≥7 points required for gout classification
Serum urate should ideally be measured when not on urate-lowering therapy and >4 weeks from acute episode
Highest serum urate value should be used regardless of timing
Synovial fluid analysis should be performed by trained observer
Double-contour sign on ultrasound or urate deposition on DECT indicates positive imaging for urate deposition
